Organization.OrgFullName: Vinmec Research Institute of Stem Cell and Gene Technology

IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: Outcomes of Expanded Autologous Bone Marrow-derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells Therapy in Type II Diabetes
IdentificationModule.OfficialTitle: Outcomes of Expanded Autologous Bone Marrow-derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells Therapy in Type 2 Diabetes

LeadSponsor.LeadSponsorName: Vinmec Research Institute of Stem Cell and Gene Technology

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of autologous bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cells transplantation in the treatment of type 2 diabetes mellitus
DescriptionModule.DetailedDescription: Bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cells have the immunosuppressive effect and secrete a variety of cytokines, improve the microenvironment of diabetic patients, targeting insulin resistance tissue, ameliorate the metabolic disorder of islet damage, protect and regeneration of the islet beta cells; reduce high blood sugar.The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of autologous bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cells transplantation in treatment 30 patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus at Vinmec International Hospital, Hanoi, Vietnam

ArmGroup.ArmGroupDescription: Intervention: 30 patients will be transplanted autologous bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cells and undergoing 2 treatment with 6 months interval

ArmGroupInterventionName: Combination Product: Expanded autologous bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cell

Intervention.InterventionName: Expanded autologous bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cell
Intervention.InterventionDescription: Collect bone marrow from lilac crest using local anaesthetic and syringe collection. Mesenchymal stem cell will be isolated, expanded and characterized in vitro under the GMP- grade procedure

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: Reduction of insulin dose requirement by â‰¥50% in both groups
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeTimeFrame: up to the 12-month period following treatment

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: Number of adverse events in both groups
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeTimeFrame: up to the 12-month period following treatment

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Improvement of HbA1c level as compared to baseline between two groups
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: up to the 12-month period following treatment

EligibilityModule.EligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Males and females from 18 years and above.
Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) is ranged from 7.5% to 9% at baseline.
Type 2 diabetes duration 5 years or more.
Before the screening, joint or combined with insulin, oral medications to treat more than 3 months.
Who signed the informed consent form.

Exclusion Criteria:

Type 1 diabetes.
Chronic disease or severe disease, including cancer, severe heart disease, kidney disease, liver disease, etc.
According to the medical doctor's judgement, may endanger the safety of the subjects

Location.LocationFacility: Vinmec Research Institute of Stem Cell and Gene Technology

Reference.ReferenceCitation: Nguyen LT, Hoang DM, Nguyen KT, Bui DM, Nguyen HT, Le HTA, Hoang VT, Bui HTH, Dam PTM, Hoang XTA, Ngo ATL, Le HM, Phung NY, Vu DM, Duong TT, Nguyen TD, Ha LT, Bui HTP, Nguyen HK, Heke M, Bui AV. Type 2 diabetes mellitus duration and obesity alter the efficacy of autologously transplanted bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem/stromal cells. Stem Cells Transl Med. 2021 Sep;10(9):1266-1278. doi: 10.1002/sctm.20-0506. Epub 2021 Jun 3.
